title: 105_hr3677
content: The conveyance of title to works, facilities, and lands is addressed in Section 1. The curr_chunk defines key terms such as "consolidated contract," "Designated Lands," and "Division" related to the agreement between Wellton-Mohawk Irrigation and Drainage District and Reclamation. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to the agreement between Wellton-Mohawk Irrigation and Drainage District and Reclamation, including Division, Memorandum of Agreement, Reclamation, and Secretary. The Secretary of the Interior is defined as the Secretary. Wellton-Mohawk Irrigation and Drainage District is defined as Wellton-Mohawk, a single reclamation purpose district. Western refers to the Department of Energy, Western Area Power Administration. The Secretary is required to convey designated lands upon fair value payment. Upon fair value payment, the United States will convey all rights and interests in designated lands, easements, and related infrastructure to Wellton-Mohawk Irrigation and Drainage District, including pumping plants, canals, drains, roads, pumps, buildings, and other improvements for water delivery. This includes facilities associated with the Wellton-Mohawk Canal and drainage systems. Reclamation is authorized to expend funds for completing the transfer of title to works, facilities, and lands. Water delivery to Wellton-Mohawk will continue as per the terms of the Consolidated Contract. The Secretary and Western will provide Wellton-Mohawk with project reserved power from the Parker and Davis Reclamation Power Plants. Wellton-Mohawk will pay the fair value of designated lands to the United States at the time of transfer. The United States will not be liable for damages after the conveyance of project works, facilities, and lands. The Memorandum of Agreement will address salinity control issues related to return flows from Wellton-Mohawk as per Public Law 93-320. The Secretary is required to submit a report to the House Committee on Resources and the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources within 18 months of the enactment of the Act regarding the status of the transfer, any obstacles, and the expected transfer date. Upon the specified date in the Memorandum of Agreement, if the transfer of rights, title, and interest from the United States to Wellton-Mohawk has not occurred, Wellton-Mohawk can tender fair value to the Secretary to automatically transfer ownership of works, facilities, and lands. The Secretary must provide title evidence upon request at no cost to Wellton-Mohawk.
